pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Note: I have pushed an update to the lean toolchain because this PR was on a [buggy version](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/Potential.20data.20loss.20from.20.60lake.20clean.60.20with.204.2E2.2E0-rc2.2F3/near/397875701) of the toolchain. **WARNING**: checking out old commits of this PR using v4.2.0-rc2 or v4.2.0-rc3 can cause `lake clean` to delete your mathlib folder! If you need to do so, make sure to delete `lakefile.olean` manually before running any `lake` commands.

> Could you also add IsCoveringMap expMapCircle?

I'll take a look! I also have plans to do `exp : C -> C\{0}` and `(. ^ n) : C -> C`, and expMapCircle is the restriction of exp to the preimage of `circle` and should probably follow from something general.

I also think proving `IsCoveringMap` is too weak and I should introduce a `IsGalCoverBy` predicate ~~that extends [FiberBundle](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/FiberBundle/Basic.html#FiberBundle)~~ and show it implies IsCoveringMap, and show it's equivalent to IsCoveringMap + the group of deck transformations acting transitively on fibers in some other PR. (See [here](https://github.com/orgs/leanprover-community/projects/13/views/2?pane=issue&itemId=42660026) for more details.)

### PR summary [febc8101b5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7596/commits/febc8101b5610d194d06c37fa4c5131af20713a8)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +50.92% | `Mathlib.Topology.Covering` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Topology.Covering | 874 | 1319 | +445 (+50.92%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Covering`|445|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsOpen.trivialization_discrete`
`+ ProperlyDiscontinuousSMul.disjoint_image_nhds`
`+ ProperlyDiscontinuousSMul.finite_stabilizer`
`+ ProperlyDiscontinuousSMul.finite_stabilizer'`
`+ Subgroup.isCoveringMap`
`+ _root_.isCoveringMapOn_quotient_of_properlyDiscontinuousSMul`
`+ _root_.isCoveringMap_quotient_of_properlyDiscontinuousSMul`
`+ disjoint_nhds_of_discrete`
`+ div_mul_period_eq_nsmul`
`+ finite_torsion`
`+ isCoveringMapOn_of_properlyDiscontinuousSMul`
`+ isCoveringMapOn_of_smul_disjoint`
`+ isCoveringMap_coe_addCircle`
`+ isCoveringMap_nsmul`
`+ isCoveringMap_of_discrete_ker_monoidHom`
`+ isCoveringMap_of_properlyDiscontinuousSMul`
`+ isCoveringMap_of_smul_disjoint`
`+ isCoveringMap_of_subgroup`
`+ nsmul_eq_zero_iff`
`+ properlyDiscontinuousSMul_of_tendsto_cofinite`
`+ properlyDiscontinuousSMul_opposite_of_tendsto_cofinite`
`+ trivialization_of_smul_disjoint`
`- Subgroup.properlyDiscontinuousSMul_of_tendsto_cofinite`
`- Subgroup.properlyDiscontinuousSMul_opposite_of_tendsto_cofinite`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1153|1|erw|

Current commit [febc8101b5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/febc8101b5610d194d06c37fa4c5131af20713a8)
Reference commit [67019e0bbf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/67019e0bbfaccd3af41e6f73024551c6e80ad2d4)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Exactly the same docstring applies for the additive version here. Is there a way to avoid duplication? Something like an `existing_doc` option?

In this case I think it's actually easier to build the trivialization rather than working with unions. Indeed the trivialization is just `(g, x) ↦ g • x`, which is continuous and open (see #7809), and you just have to prove that it's a bijection between `G • U` and `f ⁻¹' (f '' U)`.
Also, why not using pointwise notation? I think you'd have better API available.

When you say `(g, x) ↦ g • x`, the first `x` lies in X (downstairs) while the second `x` lies in E (upstairs), but the topology on E and X are not a priori "the same" (local homeomorphism) and the assumption is only that `f : E → X` is a quotient map. So I have to resort to the definition to show the continuity in the direction `G × X → E` (suffices to restrict to fixed `g : G` by my previous PR). I think most of the gymnastics in this proof is showing that the preimage of an open set `W` in `E` is `f (g⁻¹ (W ∩ U))`, and that its `f`-preimage is open by writing it as the union of `G`-translates of `W ∩ U`.

This was originally [an even longer proof](https://gist.github.com/alreadydone/40333872e072abc8125dd95d20f07f2c#file-properlydiscontinuous_coveringmap-lean-L38-L104) but I decided to extract `IsOpen.trivialization_discrete` (which can be applied to (maybe purely hypothetical) situations without a group action); a downside is that the length of these two proofs combined is 15 lines longer than the original one.

I used `(g • ·) '' U` because this is what's used in [ProperlyDiscontinuousSMul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/ConstMulAction.html#ProperlyDiscontinuousSMul). I haven't looked much into the Pointwise API, but I did use one lemmas that uses pointwise notation, [singleton_mul_mem_nhds_of_nhds_one](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Group/Basic.html#singleton_mul_mem_nhds_of_nhds_one). If you have golfs that's certainly welcome!

pullRequest.title: feat: covering maps from properly discontinuous actions and discrete subgroups

If you need to do so, make sure to delete `lakefile.olean` manually before running any `lake` commands.

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: open maps from I × X, I discrete

I'll take a look! I also have plans to do `exp : C -> C\{0}` and `(. ^ n) : C -> C`, and expMapCircle is the restriction of exp to the preimage of `circle` and should probably follow from something general.

source.title: feat: disjoint indexed union of local homeomorphisms
[Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/SpecialFunctions/Complex/Circle): `expMapCircle` as a `PartialHomeomorph` and prove `IsLocalHomeomorph`
